jobDescription: Requirements The Quality Data Analyst serves as a expert liaison in quality/performance improvement with the clinical departments with a focus on core measures, such as validating data, managing hospital databases, reporting of data to multiple organizations as required for accreditation and compliance to Medicare/Medicaid and any others that may be needed, analyzing data and identifying opportunities for improvement. Serves as a leader and/or mentor in the area of Process Improvement for the organization. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Knowledge of regulations, standards, operating definitions for evidence based measures; knowledge of National Quality Initiatives such as Leapfrog; Excellent data management skills, superior knowledge/execution of Microsoft Office and excellent skills in data analysis and presentation. Ability to work independently with strong organizational and time management skills to meet competing deadlines, ability to make administrative/procedural decisions and excellent communication skills and demonstrating collaborative work ethics as a member of the quality team.  Education: Bachelors Degree in Healthcare. Certifications/Licensure: Licensed Registered Nurse in the State of Illinois. Experience: 3-5 years Acute Care Quality Management. Schedule: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am to 4:30 pm. 8 Hours shift, 80 hours per pay period.
